dql.dataType.array.name: Array
dql.dataType.array.description: A data structure that contains a sequence of values, each identified by index.

dql.dataType.boolean.name: Boolean
dql.dataType.boolean.description: Boolean has only two possible values: true and false.

dql.dataType.duration.name: Duration
dql.dataType.duration.description: A duration between two timestamps, consisting of an amount and a time unit

dql.dataType.geopoint.name: Geopoint
dql.dataType.geopoint.description: Pair of float numbers representing geographical latitude and longitude coordinates.

dql.dataType.ip.name: IpAddress
dql.dataType.ip.description: Represents an IPv4 or IPv6 address.

dql.dataType.long.name: Long
dql.dataType.long.description: The signed long has a minimum value of -2^63 and a maximum value of 2^63-1

dql.dataType.record.name: Record
dql.dataType.record.description: A set of key-value pair data whose value can be any DQL data type.

dql.dataType.smartscapeid.name: SmartscapeId
dql.dataType.smartscapeid.description: A data type that is used to represent identifiers for smartscape.

dql.dataType.string.name: String
dql.dataType.string.description: Sequence of characters with a specified character set.

dql.dataType.timeframe.name: Timeframe
dql.dataType.timeframe.description: A specific time frame with a starttime and an endtime as timestamps with nanosecond precision.

dql.dataType.timestamp.name: Timestamp
dql.dataType.timestamp.description: A reference to a point in time with the precision of a nanosecond.

dql.dataType.uid.name: UID
dql.dataType.uid.description: A data type that is used for spans to represent 64-bit identifiers and 128-bit identifiers.

dql.parameterValueType.bucket.name: name or pattern for bucket filters
dql.parameterValueType.bucket.description: plain string used to specify the name or pattern for buckets to filter on

dql.parameterValueType.dataObject.name: data object
dql.parameterValueType.dataObject.description: is validated against the data objects in the record type repository

dql.parameterValueType.enum.name: predefined string value
dql.parameterValueType.enum.description: a static string, but only a predefined list of values is allowed

dql.parameterValueType.executionBlock.name: execution block
dql.parameterValueType.executionBlock.description: an execution block that may or may not contain commands (e.g. for a fork where [] means identity)

dql.parameterValueType.expressionTimeser.name: expression-based timeseries aggregation
dql.parameterValueType.expressionTimeser.description: a timeseries aggregation in the form of functionName(field) used to calculate timeseries on expressions

dql.parameterValueType.expressionWithCon.name: constant expression
dql.parameterValueType.expressionWithCon.description: an expression with a constant value, e.g. `1+1` is constant, but no primitive value as the `+` is executed

dql.parameterValueType.expressionWithFie.name: expression
dql.parameterValueType.expressionWithFie.description: any expression; it might also access fields from records

dql.parameterValueType.fieldPattern.name: pattern for filtering field names
dql.parameterValueType.fieldPattern.description: plain string used to specify multiple fields using a pattern with wildcards

dql.parameterValueType.identifierForAnyF.name: field identifier
dql.parameterValueType.identifierForAnyF.description: has to refer to an existing field, but it might also be a nested record list

dql.parameterValueType.identifierForEdge.name: edge type
dql.parameterValueType.identifierForEdge.description: edge types are for smartscape - they do NOT refer to an existing field and can't be nested

dql.parameterValueType.identifierForFiel.name: field identifier on root level
dql.parameterValueType.identifierForFiel.description: has to refer to an existing field on root level

dql.parameterValueType.identifierForNode.name: node type
dql.parameterValueType.identifierForNode.description: node types are for smartscape - they do NOT refer to an existing field and can't be nested

dql.parameterValueType.joinCondition.name: join condition
dql.parameterValueType.joinCondition.description: can either be a field identifier or an equality comparison of left and right fields

dql.parameterValueType.metricKey.name: metric key
dql.parameterValueType.metricKey.description: it has to be a metric key and will provide special suggestions

dql.parameterValueType.metricTimeseriesA.name: metric-based timeseries aggregation
dql.parameterValueType.metricTimeseriesA.description: a timeseries aggregation in the form of functionName(metric) to calculate timeseries on metrics

dql.parameterValueType.namelessDplPatter.name: pattern for parsing
dql.parameterValueType.namelessDplPatter.description: validated DPL pattern string, that might not contain field names

dql.parameterValueType.nonEmptyExecution.name: non-empty execution block
dql.parameterValueType.nonEmptyExecution.description: an execution block that has to contain at least one command (e.g. for a join)

dql.parameterValueType.prefix.name: prefix for flattening fields
dql.parameterValueType.prefix.description: plain string used to specify the prefix of all fields that are pushed to the root record

dql.parameterValueType.primitiveValue.name: primitive value
dql.parameterValueType.primitiveValue.description: a primitive value; usually represented by a literal

dql.parameterValueType.simpleIdentifier.name: new field name
dql.parameterValueType.simpleIdentifier.description: new field names are for aliases and names - they do NOT refer to an existing field and can't be nested

dql.parameterValueType.tabularFileExisti.name: tabular file name
dql.parameterValueType.tabularFileExisti.description: a string that represents the name of a tabular file to load

dql.parameterValueType.tabularFileNew.name: new tabular file name
dql.parameterValueType.tabularFileNew.description: a string that represents the name of a tabular file to save

dql.command.append.name: append
dql.command.append.description: Merges the current list of records with another list of records.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The sub-query to append.

dql.command.data.name: data
dql.command.data.description: Creates a static dataset to work with.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: A JSON string that holds an object or an array of objects that will represent the data set.

parameters.name: record
parameters.description: One of the static records that should be part of the data set.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: An expression to add to the record.

dql.command.dedup.name: dedup
dql.command.dedup.description: Removes duplicates from a list of records.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: An expression defining the how duplicate entries should be sorted (the first record by this order will be kept).

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: An expression defining the how duplicate entries should be sorted (the first record by this order will be kept).

parameters.name: filterPushThrough
parameters.description: Whether the filter should be push through the dedup command.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of records returned by the dedup command.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: An expression for which all different unique values should be kept.

dql.command.describe.name: describe
dql.command.describe.description: Describes the schema of a given data object.

parameters.name: dataObject
parameters.description: The data object to describe.

dql.command.expand.name: expand
dql.command.expand.description: Expands an array into separate records.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: A field or an array expression that should be expanded.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to expand.

dql.command.experimentalSave.name: experimentalSave
dql.command.experimentalSave.description: Experimental Save command to store records as table permanently.
dql.command.experimentalSave.synopsis: experimentalSave tabularFile [, overwrite] [, expiresAfter] [, maxRows] [, maxGBytes]

parameters.name: tabularFile
parameters.description: The name of the tabular file to be saved.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Determines whether the tabular file should be overwritten if a table with the same name already exists.

parameters.name: expiresAfter
parameters.description: Specifies the time duration after which the tabular file should be automatically deleted or expired.

parameters.name: maxRows
parameters.description: Sets the maximum number of rows that the tabular file can have. If the source has more rows than this limit, only the first ‘maxRows’ rows will be saved.

parameters.name: maxGBytes
parameters.description: Sets the maximum storage size (in gigabytes) that the tabular file can hold. When query returns more data then saved result is truncated.

dql.command.failIf.name: failIf
dql.command.failIf.description: Fails a query if condition evaluates to TRUE.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: The condition the query has to fulfill to fail.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The error message that will be thrown if the condition evaluates to TRUE.

dql.command.fetch.name: fetch
dql.command.fetch.synopsis: fetch dataObject [, bucket: bucket, …] [, from] [, to] [, timeframe] [, samplingRatio] [, scanLimitGBytes]

parameters.name: dataObject
parameters.description: The data object to fetch data for.

parameters.name: bucket
parameters.description: A bucket (name or pattern) to retrieve data from.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start of the timeframe (if no explicit timeframe is specified). A duration is interpreted as an offset from `now()`.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The end of the timeframe (if no explicit timeframe is specified). A duration is interpreted as an offset from `now()`.

parameters.name: timeframe
parameters.description: The desired timeframe (if not specified, global timeframe is used).

parameters.name: samplingRatio
parameters.description: The desired sampling ratio.

parameters.name: scanLimitGBytes
parameters.description: The maximum number of gigabytes that shall be scanned during loading data.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: An expression that will be retained in the result list.

dql.command.fieldsAdd.name: fieldsAdd
dql.command.fieldsAdd.description: Evaluates an expression and appends or replaces a field.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: An expression, its result will be added to the record list.

dql.command.fieldsFlatten.name: fieldsFlatten
dql.command.fieldsFlatten.description: Adds fields from a record to the current record list.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: An expression returning the record from which to add the fields.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: Prefix that is applied to all fields that are going to be added.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: Field to add from the record.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: Flatten nested records until the specified depth is reached.

dql.command.fieldsKeep.name: fieldsKeep
dql.command.fieldsKeep.description: Keeps the fields in the result.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: A field or fields based on a pattern to keep in the record list.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: A field or fields based on a pattern to remove from the record list.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: A field to rename (needs to be fully qualified).

dql.command.fieldsSummary.name: fieldsSummary
dql.command.fieldsSummary.description: Calculates the facets for the listed fields.

parameters.name: topValues
parameters.description: The number of top values for each field.

parameters.name: extrapolateSamples
parameters.description: Whether the result should be extrapolated using the sampling rate.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: A field identifier.

dql.command.filter.name: filter
dql.command.filter.description: Reduces the number of records in a list by excluding all records not matching a specific condition.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: The condition all records have to fulfill.

dql.command.filterOut.name: filterOut
dql.command.filterOut.description: Removes records that match a specific condition.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: The condition all records have to fulfill.

dql.command.join.name: join
dql.command.join.description: Joins all records from the source and the sub-query as long as they fulfill the join condition.
dql.command.join.synopsis: join joinTable [, kind] [, executionOrder ,] on: condition, … [, prefix] [, fields: { [field, …] }]

parameters.name: joinTable
parameters.description: Sub-query for records with fields to add or overwrite in the input.

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: Defines how records get joined.

parameters.name: executionOrder
parameters.description: Defines which side of the join will be executed first.

parameters.name: broadcast
parameters.description: Defines broadcasting strategy.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: Records must match this condition in order to be joined.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: Specifies a prefix string for all new fields.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: A field from the sub-query to add to the source.

dql.command.joinNested.name: joinNested
dql.command.joinNested.description: Joins all records from the source and the sub-query as long as they fulfill the join condition. The matching results from the sub-query are added as an array of nested records.
dql.command.joinNested.synopsis: joinNested joinTable, alias, on: condition, … [, executionOrder] [, fields: { [field, …] }]

parameters.name: joinTable
parameters.description: Sub-query for records with fields to add or overwrite in the input.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: Records must match this condition in order to be joined.

parameters.name: executionOrder
parameters.description: Defines which side of the join will be executed first.

parameters.name: broadcast
parameters.description: Defines broadcasting strategy.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: A field from the sub-query to add to the source.

dql.command.limit.name: limit
dql.command.limit.description: Limits the number of returned records.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The maximum number of records.

dql.command.load.name: load
dql.command.load.description: Load command to read tabular file stored by Save command.

parameters.name: tabularFile
parameters.description: The name of the tabular file that was saved.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of skipped records.

dql.command.lookup.name: lookup
dql.command.lookup.description: Loads an external record and adds the fields to the current record.
dql.command.lookup.synopsis: lookup lookupTable [, sourceField ,] lookupField [, prefix] [, fields: { [field, …] }] [, executionOrder]

parameters.name: lookupTable
parameters.description: Sub-query for records with fields to add or overwrite in the input.

parameters.name: sourceField
parameters.description: The field to use from the source for equality comparison.

parameters.name: lookupField
parameters.description: The field to use from the sub-query for equality comparison.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: Specifies a prefix string for all new fields.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: A field from the sub-query to add to the source.

parameters.name: executionOrder
parameters.description: Defines which side of the join will be executed first.

parameters.name: broadcast
parameters.description: Defines broadcasting strategy.

dql.command.makeTimeseries.name: makeTimeseries
dql.command.makeTimeseries.description: Converts the input into the time series format.
dql.command.makeTimeseries.synopsis: makeTimeseries [by: { [expression, …] }] [, interval] [, bins] [, from] [, to] [, timeframe] [, time] [, spread] [, nonempty ,] aggregation, …

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: An expression to split the series by.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: An expression that provides the duration of a bins in the series.

parameters.name: bins
parameters.description: An positive non-zero long integer number that defines the number of bins that shall be created within the series timeframe.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The global timeframe start for the series for which values should be considered.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The global timeframe end for the series for which values should be considered.

parameters.name: timeframe
parameters.description: The global timeframe end for the series for which values should be considered.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: A timestamp expression that provides the timestamp for the bucket calculation of the values in the series.

parameters.name: spread
parameters.description: A timeframe expression that provides the timeframe for the bucket calculation of the values in the series.

parameters.name: nonempty
parameters.description: Produces empty series when there is no data.

parameters.name: aggregation
parameters.description: The series that shall be calculated.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: The default value in the series bin, if no value is present.

parameters.name: rate
parameters.description: The rate the resulting series values shall be scaled to.

parameters.name: bucket
parameters.description: A bucket (name or pattern) to retrieve data from.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The global timeframe start for retrieving metrics.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The global timeframe end for retrieving metrics.

parameters.name: timeframe
parameters.description: The global timeframe for retrieving metrics.

dql.command.parse.name: parse
dql.command.parse.description: Parses a record field and puts the result(s) into one or more fields as specified in the pattern.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: A field or string expression to parse.

parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: The parse pattern.

parameters.name: preserveFieldsOnFailure
parameters.description: Determines if fields values should be preserved if parsing fails.

parameters.name: parsingPrerequisite
parameters.description: Determines if record should be parsed.

parameters.name: baseTime
parameters.description: A timestamp expression providing the base time for date/time parsing.

dql.command.search.name: search
dql.command.search.description: Reduces the number of records in a list by excluding all records where the search condition doesn't apply.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: The condition all records have to fulfill.

parameters.name: caseSensitive
parameters.description: Whether search patterns should be considered as case-sensitive (default: false).

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Where search patterns should be searched.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: A field on which to apply search patterns.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: A field to be excluded from the search for search patterns.

dql.command.smartscapeEdges.name: smartscapeEdges
dql.command.smartscapeEdges.description: Returns the edges of a smartscape graph.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The global timeframe start for retrieving the smartscape edges.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The global timeframe end for retrieving the smartscape edges.

parameters.name: timeframe
parameters.description: The global timeframe for retrieving the smartscape edges.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type or type pattern of the smartscape edges.

dql.command.smartscapeNodes.name: smartscapeNodes
dql.command.smartscapeNodes.description: Returns the nodes of a smartscape graph.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The global timeframe start for retrieving the smartscape edges.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The global timeframe end for retrieving the smartscape edges.

parameters.name: timeframe
parameters.description: The global timeframe for retrieving the smartscape edges.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type or type pattern of the smartscape nodes.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: An expression defining the sort order.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of the sorting.

dql.command.summarize.name: summarize
dql.command.summarize.description: Groups together records that have the same values for a given field and aggregates them.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: An expression to group by.

parameters.name: aggregation
parameters.description: An aggregation function (min, max, avg, ...).

dql.command.timeseries.name: timeseries
dql.command.timeseries.description: Reads metrics in the time series format from the data source.
dql.command.timeseries.synopsis: timeseries [bucket: bucket, …] [, from] [, to] [, timeframe] [, by: { [expression, …] }] [, filter] [, interval] [, bins] [, shift] [, nonempty] [, union ,] metric, …

parameters.name: bucket
parameters.description: A bucket (name or pattern) to retrieve data from.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The global timeframe start for the series for which values should be considered.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The global timeframe end for the series for which values should be considered.

parameters.name: timeframe
parameters.description: The global timeframe for the series for which values should be considered.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: An expression to split the series by.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: An additional filter condition that shall be applied on the source records before time-/space-aggregation.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: A suggested interval for the series.

parameters.name: bins
parameters.description: A suggested number of bins in the series.

parameters.name: shift
parameters.description: Shifts the effective timeframe by the provided duration.

parameters.name: nonempty
parameters.description: Produces empty series when there is no data.

parameters.name: union
parameters.description: Whether the results will be combined as union if multiple metric keys are specified.

parameters.name: metric
parameters.description: The metric that shall be calculated.

parameters.name: rollup
parameters.description: The rollup type that shall be used for the metric.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: The default value to fill gaps.

parameters.name: rate
parameters.description: The rate the resulting series values shall be scaled to.

dql.command.traverse.name: traverse
dql.command.traverse.description: Switches from the current list of records to a different one.
dql.command.traverse.synopsis: traverse edgeType, …, targetType, … [, direction] [, fieldsKeep: { [field, …] }] [, nodeId]

parameters.name: edgeType
parameters.description: The type of the edge to traverse.

parameters.name: targetType
parameters.description: The type of the target nodes.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The traversal direction.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: A field or field pattern to keep in the traversal history.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: The field that contains the id of the node in the incoming records.

parameters.description: The type of smartscapeId as string.

parameters.name: numericId
parameters.description: The numeric id of smartscapeId as long.

dql.function.splitByPattern.name: splitByPattern
dql.function.splitByPattern.description: Splits a string into an array at each occurrence of the DPL pattern.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: A field or string expression to split.

parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: The splitting pattern.

dql.function.splitString.name: splitString
dql.function.splitString.description: Splits a string at each occurrence of a pattern. If not found, returns an array with a single element that contains the full string. Splits into single-byte strings if the pattern is empty.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The string expression to split up into an array.

parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: The pattern to split the string expression at, or the empty string to split into one-byte strings.

dql.function.sqrt.name: sqrt
dql.function.sqrt.description: Computes the positive square root of a numeric expression.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The numeric expression for which to calculate the square root.

dql.function.startsWith.name: startsWith
dql.function.startsWith.description: Checks if a string expression starts with a prefix. Returns `true` if does, `false` otherwise.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The string expression that will be checked.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: The prefix string with which the expression should start.

parameters.name: caseSensitive
parameters.description: Whether the check should be done in a case-sensitive way.

dql.function.stddev.name: stddev
dql.function.stddev.description: Calculates the standard deviation of a field for a list of records.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The expression from which to compute standard deviation.

dql.function.stringLength.name: stringLength
dql.function.stringLength.description: Returns number of UTF-16 code units in given string.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The string expression to get the number of UTF-16 code units for.

dql.function.substring.name: substring
dql.function.substring.description: Gets part of a string using a start index (inclusive) and an optional end index (exclusive).Negative indexes are relative to the last code unit. Indexes that are out-of-bounds are clamped at the string length for positive indexes, and at zero for negative indexes.Returns empty string in case of out-of-bounds indexes.Indexes are in UTF-16 code units and may not correspond to a single character.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The string expression to get a substring of.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Index of first code unit to include in sub-string, inclusive, relative to start of `expression` if positive, relative to end if negative. Clamped at string bounds.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Index of last code unit to include in sub-string, exclusive, relative to start of `expression` if positive, relative to end if negative. Clamped at string bounds.

dql.function.sum.name: sum
dql.function.sum.description: Calculates the sum of a field for a list of records.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The expression from which to compute the sum.

dql.function.takeAny.name: takeAny
dql.function.takeAny.description: Returns a value of a field for a list of records. Any record can be given despite records are ordered or not.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The expression from which to take any element.

dql.function.takeFirst.name: takeFirst
dql.function.takeFirst.description: Returns the first value of a field for a list of records in the current order.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The expression from which to take the first element.

dql.function.takeLast.name: takeLast
dql.function.takeLast.description: Returns the last value of a field for a list of records in the current order.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The expression from which to take the last element.

dql.function.takeMax.name: takeMax
dql.function.takeMax.description: Returns the maximum value of a field for a list of records. The records will be ordered based on the field data type and the field value and the maximum will be taken.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: "The expression from which to take the maximum element.

dql.function.takeMin.name: takeMin
dql.function.takeMin.description: Returns the minimum value of a field for a list of records. The records will be ordered based on the field data type and the field value and the minimum will be taken.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The expression from which to take the minimum element.

dql.function.tan.name: tan
dql.function.tan.description: Calculate the tan of the given expression as an angle in radians.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The numeric expression, angle in radians for which to calculate the tan.

dql.function.tanh.name: tanh
dql.function.tanh.description: Calculate the tanh of the given expression as an angle in radians.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The numeric expression, angle in radians for which to calculate the tanh.

dql.function.timeframe.name: timeframe
dql.function.timeframe.description: Creates a `timeframe` from the given start and end timestamp or duration.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start of the timeframe. Can be a timestamp or a duration. A duration is interpreted as an offset from `now()`.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The end of the timeframe. Can be a timestamp or a duration. A duration is interpreted as an offset from `now()`.

dql.function.timestamp.name: timestamp
dql.function.timestamp.description: Creates a `timestamp` from the provided values.
dql.function.timestamp.synopsis: timestamp(year, month, day, hour, minute, second [, millis] [, micros] [, nanos] [, timezone])

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: The year of the timestamp as a number.

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: The month of the timestamp as a number.

parameters.name: day
parameters.description: The day of the timestamp as a number.

parameters.name: hour
parameters.description: The hour of the timestamp as a number.

parameters.name: minute
parameters.description: The minute of the timestamp as a number.

parameters.name: second
parameters.description: The second of the timestamp as a number.

parameters.name: millis
parameters.description: The millisecond of the timestamp as a number.

parameters.name: micros
parameters.description: The microsecond of the timestamp as a number.

parameters.name: nanos
parameters.description: The nanosecond of the timestamp as a number.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The timezone used to format the timestamp.

dql.function.timestampFromUnixMillis.name: timestampFromUnixMillis
dql.function.timestampFromUnixMillis.description: Creates a `timestamp` from the given milliseconds since Unix epoch.

parameters.name: millis
parameters.description: Milliseconds since unix start time.

dql.function.timestampFromUnixNanos.name: timestampFromUnixNanos
dql.function.timestampFromUnixNanos.description: Creates a `timestamp` from the given nanoseconds since Unix epoch.

parameters.name: nanos
parameters.description: Nanoseconds since unix start time.

dql.function.timestampFromUnixSeconds.name: timestampFromUnixSeconds
dql.function.timestampFromUnixSeconds.description: Creates a `timestamp` from the given seconds since Unix epoch.

parameters.name: seconds
parameters.description: Seconds since unix start time.
